snippet: Monte dei Paschi, the world’s oldest bank, was the center of life in Siena, Italy. So when it nearly collapsed, the city was left scrambling to fill the void.
abstract: Italian city Siena is struggling to cope with near collapse of Banca Monte dei Paschi di Siena, as foundation that owned bank used to fund wide variety of social services and events; is seeking to draw in outside investment, particularly from pharmaceutical companies, mirroring countrywide effort to overcome Italy's reputation of being bad place for business in order to spur economic growth.

byline.original: By JACK EWING and GAIA PIANIGIANI

lead_paragraph: Monte dei Paschi, the world’s oldest bank, was the center of life in Siena, Italy. So when it nearly collapsed, the city was left scrambling to fill the void.

headline.main: Siena Tries to Regain Its Financial Footing, and Its Identity
